nodes.bodyText: Could you revert this file (since there are no real modifications) ?
Yes, ok. Is seems to be reverted, but in this review it is compared with my previous version. But is reverted to the original one.
First, could you use helpers here? Second, why do we return empty for title block annotation here?
If I use the helper (TitleBlockHelper), I introduce a cyclic dependency. I return empty String because otherwise in Properties view it displays "(DAnnotaion) Diagram Title Block" in the title.
I undo changes in this file, moved it to Title Block providers but will show the meta class Title Block.

nodes.bodyText: Revert this file if no modification.
OK. I reverted to the original vers, diff will appear because on titleBlocks branch already contains some changes on this file.
This should be the uri of the package containing DAnnotation class
This should be the only check.
I don't understand, keep only TitleBlockHelper.isTitleBlockAnnotation or target instanceof DAnnotation.
There's no need to extend DescriptionItemProviderAdapterFactory. You could just pass it directly to the decorator.
Is because I kept the original provider for DAnnotation (added this provider only if the DAnnotation is for aTitle Block).
